Pre-Game Insights: The St. Louis Cardinals (67-67) are headed to Yankee Stadium on Sunday where they will attempt to defeat the New York Yankees (78-56).
The expected starting pitchers will be Miles Mikolas and Nestor Cortes Jr.
As a unit, the St. Louis Cardinals are knocking in 4.1 runs per outing, which has them at 24th in baseball.
The Cardinals have an ERA of 4.13 on the campaign (18th in baseball), and their staff has rung up 1,053 hitters.
The New York Yankees have accumulated a team on-base percentage of .335 as well as a batting average of .251 this year.
The Yankees have a SLG% of .440 and they have an average of 5.06 runs per game (2nd in MLB).
The New York pitching staff have yielded 552 runs this season while holding an ERA of 3.75 (500 earned runs conceded).
